s-1.ptxt: INSTALL MANUAL VALVE LEVER SHAFT OIL SEAL

s2.ptxt: Using SST, tap in 2 new oil seals.
Coat the oil seal lips with MP grease.
Install a new spacer to the manual valve lever.
Insert the manual valve lever shaft into the transmission case through the manual valve lever to install it.
Using a hammer, tap in a new spring pin.
Align the manual valve lever indentation with the spacer hole, and stake them with a pin punch.
Check that the shaft rotates smoothly.
Coat 5 new O-rings with ATF, and install them to the inner piston, reaction sleeve and No. 3 brake piston.

atten3.ptxt: The thinner O-ring must be installed to the outside of the sleeve.

s2.ptxt: Assemble the inner piston, sleeve and outer piston.
Stand the transmission case on its end.
Press the assembled pistons into the transmission case by hand to install them.

atten3.ptxt: Be careful not to damage the O-rings.

s2.ptxt: Place the brake return spring onto the outer piston.
Set SST as shown in the illustration and compress the return spring with SST.
Install the snap ring with a snap ring expander. Make sure that the end gap of the snap ring is not aligned with the spring seat claw.
Check that the No. 3 brake pistons move smoothly when applying and releasing compressed air from the transmission case.
Coat the race with petroleum jelly, and install it to the transmission case.

atten3.ptxt: Be careful of the installation direction of the race.

s2.ptxt: Align the locking tab of the tube with the cutout of the case and install the tube.

atten4.ptxt: Make sure that the lips of the tube end are completely inserted into the outer piston.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL PLANETARY OUTPUT SHAFT OIL SEAL RING

s2.ptxt: Coat a new oil seal ring with ATF.
Connect the oil seal ring's ends and install it to the output shaft.

atten4.ptxt: After installing the oil seal ring, check that it rotates smoothly.

atten3.ptxt: Do not stretch the ring excessively.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL INTERMEDIATE SHAFT SLEEVE OIL SEAL RING

s2.ptxt: Coat a new oil seal ring with ATF, and install it to the intermediate shaft.

atten4.ptxt: After installing the oil seal ring, check that it rotates smoothly.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL REAR PLANETARY RING GEAR SUB-ASSEMBLY

s2.ptxt: Coat the bearing with petroleum jelly, and install it to the intermediate shaft.

atten3.ptxt: Be careful of the installation direction of the bearing.

s2.ptxt: Install the ring gear to the intermediate shaft.
Install the set ring.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL REAR PLANETARY GEAR ASSEMBLY WITH INTERMEDIATE SHAFT SUB-ASSEMBLY

s2.ptxt: Coat the bearing and race with petroleum jelly, and install them to the ring gear.

atten3.ptxt: Be careful to the installation direction of the bearing and race.

s2.ptxt: Install the rear planetary gear assembly with intermediate shaft sub-assembly to the output shaft.
Install the snap ring.
Align the snap ring ends with the wide cutout portion of the output shaft.
Using a snap ring expander, install the ring gear while compressing the snap ring.
Check that the snap ring is installed to the groove of the output shaft.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL NO. 2 PLANETARY CARRIER THRUST WASHER

s2.ptxt: Coat the thrust washer with petroleum jelly, and install the thrust washer to the rear planetary gear.

atten4.ptxt: Make sure that the tabs of the washer are aligned with the cutout portions on the rear planetary gear.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL REAR PLANETARY GEAR ASSEMBLY WITH INTERMEDIATE SHAFT SUB-ASSEMBLY

s2.ptxt: Coat the bearing with petroleum jelly, and install it to the planetary gear.

atten3.ptxt: Be careful of the installation direction of the bearing.

s2.ptxt: Install the rear planetary gear assembly with intermediate shaft sub-assembly and output shaft assembly to the transmission case.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL NO. 3 BRAKE DISC SET AND NO. 3 BRAKE PRESSURE PLATE

s2.ptxt: Install the pressure plate with its flat surface facing the front of the transmission case.
Install the 5 discs and 4 plates.

specitem.ptxt: D - P - D - P - D - P - D - P - D

atten4.ptxt: P = Plate
D = Disc

s-1.ptxt: INSPECT PACK CLEARANCE OF NO. 3 BRAKE

s2.ptxt: Using a vernier caliper, measure the clearance between the disc and transmission case, as shown in the illustration.
If the result is not as specified, replace the pressure plate with one of a different thickness.

atten4.ptxt: There are 6 different ranges of thickness for the pressure plate.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL NO. 3 PLANETARY CARRIER THRUST WASHER

s2.ptxt: Coat the thrust washer with petroleum jelly, and install the thrust washer to the front planetary gear.

atten4.ptxt: Make sure that the tabs of the washer are aligned with the cutout portions on the front planetary gear.

s2.ptxt: Install the 1-way clutch and 2 retainers to the planetary gear, as shown in the illustration.

atten4.ptxt: Make sure that the open end of the 1-way clutch is facing upward.

s2.ptxt: Using a screwdriver, install the snap ring.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL NO. 2 1-WAY CLUTCH INNER RACE SUB-ASSEMBLY

s2.ptxt: Install the inner race while turning it counterclockwise.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL NO. 1 PLANETARY CARRIER THRUST WASHER

s2.ptxt: Coat the thrust washer with petroleum jelly, and install the thrust washer to the planetary gear.

atten4.ptxt: Make sure that the tabs of the washer are aligned with the holes on the front planetary gear.

s2.ptxt: Hold the 1-way clutch and inner race and turned the planetary gear. Check that planetary gear can be turned counterclockwise but cannot be turned clockwise.
Remove the 1-way clutch inner race from the planetary gear assembly.
Install the planetary gear.

atten4.ptxt: Mesh the splines of the planetary gear with the teeth of the discs by rotating and pushing the planetary gear.

s2.ptxt: Position the notched tooth of the inner race toward the valve body side of the case and push the race into place.

atten4.ptxt: The inner race is correctly installed if the snap ring groove is fully visible.

s2.ptxt: Using a screwdriver, install the snap ring.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL SUN GEAR SHAFT OIL SEAL RING

s2.ptxt: Coat 2 new oil seal rings with ATF.
Connect the oil seal ring ends, and install the oil seal rings to the sun gear.

atten3.ptxt: Do not stretch the rings excessively.

atten4.ptxt: After installing the oil seal rings, check that they rotate smoothly.

s2.ptxt: Install the 1-way clutch to the outer race with its open end facing rearward.
Install the 2 retainers.
Install 2 new retainers to the outer race.
Using a pin punch and hammer, stake the claws of the retainers.
Install the 1-way clutch to the sun gear.
Hold the No. 1 1-way clutch and turn the sun gear. Check that the sun gear can be turned counterclockwise but cannot be turned clockwise.
Coat a new O-ring with ATF and install it to the center support.
Coat a new O-ring with ATF and install it to the brake piston.
Install the brake piston.
Place SST on the brake piston.
Press the brake piston into the center support by hand.

atten3.ptxt: Be careful not to damage the O-rings.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL NO. 2 BRAKE PISTON RETURN SPRING SUB-ASSEMBLY

s2.ptxt: Install the piston return spring.
Place SST on the spring seat and compress the return spring with press.
Using a snap ring expander, install the snap ring. Make sure the end gap of the snap ring is not aligned with the spring seat claw.
Install the 3 plates and 3 discs.

specitem.ptxt: P - D - P - D - P - D

atten4.ptxt: P = Plate
D = Disc

s2.ptxt: Install the flange with its flat end facing downward.
Using a screwdriver, install the snap ring. Make sure the end gap of the snap ring is not aligned with the cutout portion of the center support.

s-1.ptxt: INSPECT PISTON STROKE OF NO. 2 BRAKE

s2.ptxt: Using a dial indicator, measure the No. 2 brake piston stroke by applying and releasing compressed air (392 to 785 kPa (4 to 8 kgf/cm2, 57 to 114 psi)), as shown in the illustration.
If the stroke is not as specified, inspect the discs.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL CENTER SUPPORT OIL SEAL RING

s2.ptxt: Coat 3 new oil seal rings with ATF.
Connect the oil seal ring ends and install the oil seal rings to the center support.

atten4.ptxt: After installing the oil seal rings, check that they rotate smoothly.

atten3.ptxt: Do not stretch the rings excessively.

s2.ptxt: Coat 2 new O-rings with ATF and install them to the brake piston.
Install brake piston.
Place SST on the brake piston.
Press the No. 1 brake piston into the center support by hand.

atten3.ptxt: Be careful not to damage the O-rings.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL NO. 1 BRAKE PISTON RETURN SPRING SUB-ASSEMBLY

s2.ptxt: Install the piston return spring.
Place SST on the spring seat and compress the return spring with a press.
Using a snap ring expander, install the snap ring. Make sure the end gap of the snap ring is not aligned with the spring seat claw.
Install the 3 plates and 2 discs.

atten4.ptxt: P = Plate
D = Disc

s2.ptxt: Install the flange with its rounded edge facing upward.
Using a screwdriver, install the snap ring. Make sure the end gap of the snap ring is not aligned with the cutout portion of the center support.

s-1.ptxt: INSPECT PISTON STROKE OF NO. 1 BRAKE

s2.ptxt: Using a dial indicator, measure the brake piston stroke by applying and releasing compressed air (392 to 785 kPa (4 to 8 kgf/cm2, 57 to 114 psi)), as shown in the illustration.
If the stroke is not as specified, inspect the discs.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL PLANETARY SUN GEAR SUB-ASSEMBLY WITH NO. 1 1-WAY CLUTCH ASSEMBLY

s2.ptxt: While turning the 1-way clutch, install the planetary sun gear sub-assembly with No. 1 1-way clutch assembly.
Using a snap ring expander, install the snap ring.
Face the bolt holes and oil holes of the center support toward the valve body side, and align them with the bolt holes and oil holes of the transmission case and install the center support.
Install the 2 wave washers with the 2 bolts.

atten4.ptxt: First tighten the bolt on the accumulator piston side.

s2.ptxt: Coat 4 new O-rings with ATF, and install them to the rear clutch piston.
Install the rear clutch piston to the rear clutch drum.
Place SST on the rear clutch piston.
Press the rear clutch piston into the clutch drum by hand.

atten3.ptxt: Be careful not to damage the O-rings.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL REAR CLUTCH RETURN SPRING SUB-ASSEMBLY

s2.ptxt: Install the clutch return spring.
Place SST on the clutch return spring and compress the clutch return spring with a press.
Install the snap ring with a snap ring expander. Make sure the end gap of the snap ring is not aligned with the spring seat claw.
Install the 3 plates and 3 discs.

specitem.ptxt: P - D - P - D - P - D

atten4.ptxt: P = Plate
D = Disc

s2.ptxt: Install the flange with its flat side facing downward.
Using a screwdriver, install the snap ring. Make sure the end gap of the snap ring is not aligned with the cutout portion of the rear clutch drum.

s-1.ptxt: INSPECT PISTON STROKE OF REAR CLUTCH

s2.ptxt: Place the rear clutch onto the center support.
Using a dial indicator, measure the rear clutch piston stroke by applying and releasing compressed air (392 to 785 kPa (4 to 8 kgf/cm2, 57 to 114 psi)), as shown in the illustration.
If the piston stroke is not as specified, parts may have been assembled incorrectly. Check the parts and reassemble again.

item.ptxt: If the piston stroke is still not as specified, replace the flange with one of a different thickness.
There are 3 different ranges of flange thicknesses.

s2.ptxt: Install the rear clutch.

item.ptxt: Mesh the splines of the rear clutch drum with the teeth of the No. 1 brake discs by rotating and pushing the rear clutch.
If the rear clutch drum is fully meshed with the No. 1 brake discs the splined center of the rear clutch drum will be flush with the end of the sun gear shaft.

s2.ptxt: Coat the race with petroleum jelly, and install it to the rear clutch.

atten3.ptxt: Be careful of the installation direction of the race.

s2.ptxt: Coat 2 new O-rings with ATF and install them to the front clutch piston.
Install the front clutch piston.
Place SST on the front clutch piston.
Press the clutch piston into the front clutch drum by hand.

atten3.ptxt: Be careful not to damage the O-rings.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL FRONT CLUTCH RETURN SPRING SUB-ASSEMBLY

s2.ptxt: Install the return spring.
Place SST on the spring seat and compress the return spring with a press.
Using a snap ring expander, install the snap ring. Make sure the end gap of the snap ring is not aligned with the spring seat claw.
Install the 4 plates and 3 discs.

specitem.ptxt: P - D - P - D - P - D - P

atten4.ptxt: P = Plate
D = Disc

s2.ptxt: Install the snap ring. Make sure the end gap of the snap ring is not aligned with the cutout portion of the front clutch drum.
Install the disc.

s-1.ptxt: INSPECT PISTON STROKE OF FRONT CLUTCH

s2.ptxt: In order to check the piston stroke, install the rear clutch hub.
Install the snap ring.
Using SST and a dial indicator, measure the front clutch piston stroke by applying and releasing compressed air (392 to 785 kPa (4 to 8 kgf/cm2, 57 to 114 psi)), as shown in the illustration.
If the piston stroke is not as specified, parts may have been assembled incorrectly. Check the parts and reassemble again.

item.ptxt: If the piston stroke is still not as specified, replace plates with plates of a different thickness as necessary until the piston stroke is as specified.
There are 2 different plate ranges of thickness.

s2.ptxt: Remove the snap ring and rear clutch hub.
Coat the bearing and races with petroleum jelly, and install them to the front clutch drum.

atten3.ptxt: Be careful of the installation direction of the bearing and races.

s2.ptxt: Install the front clutch hub to the front clutch drum.

atten4.ptxt: Mesh the splines of the front clutch hub with the teeth of the discs by rotating and pushing the front clutch hub.

s2.ptxt: Install the rear clutch hub.
Install the snap ring. Make sure the end gap of the snap ring is not aligned with the cutout portion of the front clutch drum.
Remove the front clutch from the overdrive case.
Coat the 2 bearings and race with petroleum jelly, and install them to the front clutch.

atten3.ptxt: Be careful of the installation direction of the thrust bearings and race.

s2.ptxt: Install the front clutch.

atten4.ptxt: Mesh the splines of the front clutch with the teeth of the discs by rotating and pushing the front clutch.

s-1.ptxt: INSPECT INSTALLATION DISTANCE OF FRONT CLUTCH ASSEMBLY

s2.ptxt: Place SST on the transmission case.
Using a vernier caliper, measure the distance between the top of the clutch drum and SST.
If the measured distance is the same as the measured distance noted during disassembly, the front clutch is installed correctly.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL CLUTCH DRUM OIL SEAL RING

s2.ptxt: Coat 2 new oil seal rings with ATF.
Connect the oil seal rings ends install the oil seal rings to the overdrive case.

atten4.ptxt: After installing the oil seal rings, check that they rotate smoothly.

atten3.ptxt: Do not stretch the rings excessively.

s2.ptxt: Coat 2 new O-rings with ATF, and install them to the overdrive brake piston.
Press the brake piston into the overdrive case by hand to install it.

atten3.ptxt: Be careful not to damage the O-rings.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL OVERDRIVE BRAKE RETURN SPRING SUB-ASSEMBLY

s2.ptxt: Install the overdrive brake return spring.
Install the snap ring while pushing the overdrive brake return spring with a screwdriver. Make sure the end gap of the snap ring is not aligned with the cutout portion of the overdrive case.

atten4.ptxt: Make sure that the snap ring is inserted into its groove.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL OVERDRIVE PLANETARY RING GEAR SUB-ASSEMBLY

s2.ptxt: Coat the bearing and races with petroleum jelly, and install them to the overdrive case.

atten3.ptxt: Be careful of the installation direction of the bearing and races.

s2.ptxt: Install the overdrive planetary ring gear.
Install the 3 plates, 3 discs and flange with the rounded edge of the flange facing upward.

specitem.ptxt: P - D - P - D - P - D - F

atten4.ptxt: F = Flange
D = Disc
P = Plate

s2.ptxt: Using a screwdriver, install the snap ring. Make sure the end gap of the snap ring is not aligned with the cutout portion of the overdrive case.
Temporarily install SST to the transmission case.

atten4.ptxt: Remove the SST after installation of the oil pump.

s2.ptxt: Coat the No. 1 overdrive planetary gear thrust washer and race with petroleum jelly, and install them to the overdrive brake.

atten3.ptxt: Be careful of the installation direction of the race.

s2.ptxt: Slide the overdrive brake gently onto the 2 guide bolts (SST) with the cutout portion of the case facing the valve body side to install the overdrive brake.

s-1.ptxt: INSPECT PACK CLEARANCE OF OVERDRIVE BRAKE

s2.ptxt: Using a dial indicator, measure the overdrive brake pack clearance by applying and releasing compressed air (392 to 785 kPa (4 to 8 kgf/cm2, 57 to 114 psi)), as shown in the illustration.
If the pack clearance is not as specified, parts may have been assembled incorrectly. Check the parts and reassemble again.

item.ptxt: If the pack clearance is still not as specified, replace plates with plates of a different thickness as necessary until the pack clearance is as specified.
There are 2 different ranges of plate thickness.

s2.ptxt: Coat the bearing with petroleum jelly, and install it to the overdrive planetary gear.

atten3.ptxt: Be careful of the installation direction of the thrust bearing.

s2.ptxt: Install the 1-way clutch to the outer race with its open end facing upward.
Install the 2 retainers.
Install the No. 3 thrust washer, 1-way clutch and No. 4 thrust washer.
Using a screwdriver, install the snap ring.

atten4.ptxt: Tape the screwdriver tip before use.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL OVERDRIVE DIRECT CLUTCH PISTON SUB-ASSEMBLY

s2.ptxt: Coat 2 new O-rings with ATF and install them to the overdrive direct clutch piston.
Install the direct clutch piston.
Place SST on the direct clutch piston.
Press the direct clutch piston into the clutch drum by hand.

atten3.ptxt: Be careful not to damage the O-rings.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL OVERDRIVE CLUTCH RETURN SPRING SUB-ASSEMBLY

s2.ptxt: Install the return spring.
Place SST on the clutch return spring and compress the clutch return spring with a press.
Using a snap ring expander, install the snap ring. Make sure the end gap of the snap ring is not aligned with the spring seat claw.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL OVERDRIVE CLUTCH FLANGE AND CUSHION PLATE

s2.ptxt: Install the cushion plate and flange with the rounded edge facing upward.

atten4.ptxt: C = Cushion plate

s2.ptxt: F = Flange
Using a screwdriver, install the snap ring. Make sure the end gap of the snap ring is not aligned with the cutout portion of the drum.
Install the overdrive brake hub.
Using a screwdriver, install the snap ring. Make sure the end gap of the snap ring is not aligned with the cutout portion of the drum.

s-1.ptxt: INSPECT PISTON STROKE OF OVERDRIVE DIRECT CLUTCH

s2.ptxt: Place the overdrive direct clutch onto the oil pump.
Using a dial indicator, measure the overdrive direct clutch piston stroke by applying and releasing compressed air (392 to 785 kPa (4 to 8 kgf/cm2, 57 to 114 psi)), as shown in the illustration.
If the piston stroke is not as specified, parts may have been assembled incorrectly. Check the parts and reassemble again.
Install the direct clutch to the overdrive planetary gear.

atten4.ptxt: Mesh the splines of the overdrive planetary gear with the teeth of the disc by rotating and pushing the overdrive planetary gear.

s2.ptxt: Hold the overdrive direct clutch drum and be turned the input shaft. Check that the input shaft can be turned clockwise but cannot be turned counterclockwise.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL OVERDRIVE PLANETARY GEAR ASSEMBLY WITH OVERDRIVE DIRECT CLUTCH ASSEMBLY

s2.ptxt: Coat the No. 2 overdrive planetary gear thrust washer with petroleum jelly, and install it to the overdrive direct clutch.
Coat the race with petroleum jelly, and install it to the overdrive direct clutch.

atten3.ptxt: Be careful of the installation direction of the race.

s2.ptxt: Install the overdrive planetary gear assembly with overdrive direct clutch assembly.

atten4.ptxt: Mesh the splines of the overdrive direct clutch with the teeth of the discs by rotating and pushing the overdrive direct clutch.

s-1.ptxt: INSPECT INSTALLATION DISTANCE OF OVERDRIVE DIRECT CLUTCH ASSEMBLY

s2.ptxt: Place SST on the transmission case.
Using a vernier caliper, measure the distance between the top of the clutch drum and SST.
If the measured distance is the same as the measured distance noted during disassembly, the overdrive direct clutch is installed correctly.
Coat a new O-ring with ATF, and install it to the overdrive brake.
Temporarily install the transmission housing with the 6 bolts.
Tighten the bolts.
Coat the bearing with petroleum jelly, and install it to the oil pump.

atten3.ptxt: Be careful of the installation direction of the bearing.

s2.ptxt: Coat a new O-ring with ATF, and install it to the pump body.
Slide the oil pump gently onto the SST (2 guide bolts) to install it.
Apply adhesive to the bolt heads.
Temporarily install the 5 bolts.
Using a screwdriver, remove the SST.
Temporarily install the 2 bolts.
Tighten all the bolts.
Check that the input shaft rotates smoothly.
Using a dial indicator, measure the end play of the output shaft while moving the output shaft by hand.
If the end play is not as specified, check for improper installation.
Check that the output shaft rotates smoothly.
Check for operating noise while applying compressed air to the oil holes indicated in the illustration.

s3.ptxt: If there is no noise, disassemble and check the installation condition of the parts.

s2.ptxt: Install a new E-ring to the shaft.
Install the parking lock pawl, shaft and spring.
Connect the parking lock rod to the manual valve lever to install it.
Install the parking lock pawl bracket with the 2 wave washers and 2 bolts.
Shift the manual valve lever to the P position, and confirm that the planetary ring gear is correctly locked by the lock pawl.
Coat 6 new O-rings with ATF and install 2 to each piston.
Install the 3 springs and 3 accumulator pistons to the 3 holes, as shown in the illustration.
Align the groove of the manual valve to the pin of the lever.
Install the valve body with the 17 bolts.

atten4.ptxt: Each bolt length is indicated below.
36 mm (1.42 in.) for A
28 mm (1.10 in.) for B
45 mm (1.77 in.) for C
30 mm (1.18 in.) for D

s2.ptxt: Coat the O-ring of the transmission wire connector with ATF.
Install the transmission wire to the case with the bolt.
Connect the connectors to the 4 shift solenoid valves.
Install the clamp with the bolt.
Using a plastic-faced hammer, tap in the tube as shown in the illustration.

atten3.ptxt: Be careful not to bend or damage the tube.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL VALVE BODY OIL STRAINER ASSEMBLY

s2.ptxt: Install 3 new gaskets to the oil strainer.
Install the oil strainer with the 3 bolts.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL AUTOMATIC TRANSMISSION OIL PAN SUB-ASSEMBLY

s2.ptxt: Install the 2 magnets to the oil pan.

atten3.ptxt: Make sure that the magnets do not interfere with the oil pipes.

s2.ptxt: Install a new gasket to the transmission case.

atten4.ptxt: Align the cutout part of the gasket and case.

s2.ptxt: Install the oil pan with the 14 bolts.
Install a new gasket and the cover with the 3 screws.
Using a snap ring expander, install the front side snap ring.
Install the key and sensor rotor.
Using a snap ring expander, install the rear side snap ring.
Using a screwdriver and hammer, tap in a new dust deflector.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL AUTOMATIC TRANSMISSION EXTENSION HOUSING OIL SEAL

s2.ptxt: Coat the lip of a new oil seal with MP grease.
Using SST and a hammer, tap in the oil seal.

atten3.ptxt: Be careful not to damage the lip of the oil seal.

s2.ptxt: Install a new dust seal to a new retainer.
Using SST and a hammer, tap in the dust seal together with the retainer.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL EXTENSION HOUSING BUSH APPLY TUBE

s2.ptxt: Install the tube and a new gasket to the extension housing.
Install a new gasket and extension housing to the case.
Apply adhesive to the bolts labeled A.
Install the 6 bolts.

atten4.ptxt: Each bolt length is indicated below.
45 mm (1.77 in.) for bolt A
35 mm (1.38 in.) for bolt B

s2.ptxt: Coat a new O-ring with ATF, and install it to the sensor.
Install the sensor with the bolt.
Coat new O-ring with ATF, and install it to the sensor.
Install the sensor with the bolt.
Coat a new O-ring with ATF, and install it to the sensor.
Install the sensor with the bolt.
Coat 2 new O-rings with ATF, and install one to each tube union.
Install the 2 tube unions.
Coat the O-ring of the ATF temperature sensor with ATF.
Install the sensor.
Install the switch to the manual valve lever shaft, and temporarily install the adjusting bolt.
Install a new lock washer with the nut.
Using the control shaft lever, turn the manual lever shaft clockwise until it stops, and then turn it counterclockwise 2 notches to set it to the N position.
Align the neutral basic line with the switch groove, and tighten the adjusting bolt.
Bend the tabs of the lock washer.

atten4.ptxt: Bend at least 2 of the lock washer tabs.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL TRANSMISSION CONTROL SHAFT LEVER LH

s2.ptxt: Install the control shaft lever with the spring washer and nut.
